body: just noticed, it's probably the same as https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/833

the "used" amount (first value) now seems to have updated to the correct value... but the second is still some fantasy value (697.7 gb now, in comparison to the 637.6 gb before - but nothing has changed regarding disk or external mount configuration).
@randolfcarter may i ask you to retest 4.5.6 and see if this issue has been fixed? should be from my understanding. thx

the first value (used bytes) looks good now in my installation. i still don't know what the second value is supposed to represent, though. for one user having no custom mounts, it shows the currently available space on the disk where the data directory is (471,4gb); for another user which has 3 local custom mounts (pointing to the same partition on the same harddrive, but different directories as the data folder) plus a dropbox mount, it still shows some fantasy value (743,8 gb), for which i have no idea how this value is determined:
dropbox space is ~5gb, and the local space is 471,4 gb, so where is the remaining 298gb coming from?

and if it's supposed to be the still available **free** space, why does it say " **of** the available" which would suggest that following is the **total available space**? and the total space is somewhere at 1,5tb, so that has nothing to do with the seen 743gb as well...

i can confirm this issue also for 5.0.6. but maybe my database is somewhere corrupted. is there a way to initiate a recalculation for this manualy?

about my setup: lamp stack on a debian 7 raspberry pi, owncloud upgraded from 4.0 -> 4.5 -> 5.0, i also changed the sd card and copied the image to a larger sd card.

i've just upgraded owncloud to version 5.0.8 and i have the same ongoing problem!

when i log in to owncloud i see at the top of the page, a banner saying: "your storage is full, files can not be updated or synced anymore!"

when i go to personal there is a message saying: "you have used 2.1 gb of the available 2.1 gb".

that's completely wrong as currently my server shows: "web space  4.26%    	4.26 gb         -   capacity:	100.00 gb"

first, i had set up unlimited quotas for users. next, i tried to add fixed values. nothing works. searched for solutions, people are reporting same issues with previous version (i can confirm that problem existed in 5.0.6 and previous) and... no fix, no solution made. come on! i've been trying to use owncloud since version 4. waited till it gets better and when version 5 was released thought - okay finally it is time to try to sync some files - version 5.0.0 - failure, waited bit more - tried to sync 17gb of data, first 2gb were synced and then it stopped. i'd assume this is connected to wrong capacity value.

personally, i wouldn't recommend owncloud to anyone. it is to immature product. do not use it!

it has no file encryption. do you remember that this existed in version 4 and was supposed to be redone in ver. 5. now it is abandon.
issues are reported and then closed and next people report the same issues over and over again.
for example, a lot of users complained that sync client is syncing files not to root directory but to clientsync folder. new clients are released and you still have to edit configuration file manually.
there are ongoing syncing problems and they had been advertising this as "dropbox alternative". what a joke!
do you want to have a headache? then go ahead and try owncloud!

you have been warned.

@iaforek thank you for the encouraging words. we don’t force you to use owncloud, and we do our best to make it great software. it’s just very difficult to make it work on all the different platforms and we appreciate any help.

if you can follow the [issue template](https://raw.github.com/owncloud/core/master/issue_template.md) or [contribute code](http://doc.owncloud.org/server/5.0/developer_manual/) as well as you can write lengthy rants, then please join us.

i'm using the latest (public available) owncloud 5.0.10 at the moment and this issue still occurs. currently my owncloud setup uses about 25gb on my harddrive (2 of them are the owncloud.log) - so the filesystem uses about 23gb.

however, the user panel states, that i only use 2gb of the (correctly) calculated 2tb harddrive.

still seeing strange numbers there... and they also are changing. today when i started the client, it showed something like "111gb of 541gb", and now, it shows "330gb of 748gb". it's the same as in the personal section, but i wonder what these values should represent. neither 541 nor 748 is the amount of free space on that machine (that would be 419gb only counting the external hard disk always mounted, or approximately 930gb if the nas is up and mounted. also not the total space, that would be 917gb or ~2,8tb in these situations, respectively. so i'm still clueless as to what values it shows... will check if i have some time - can anybody give me a hint where to check how the values are determined, or what they *should* represent?
i would love to be able to close this issue finally...
but in any case, they are now thank good consistent in client and personal page :).

edit: am i correct in assuming the  calculation logic for the used space is in the getfileinfo function in lib/files/view.php? and that value seems plausible
what seems to be somehow wrong, though, is the second value... but i think i have an idea now. the value contains only the storage of the root folder if i have seen correctly in the code (lib/files/view.php, basicoperation), right? but it indeed is the sum of the free space plus the used space (see lib/helper.php, getstorageinfo).

so what confused me the whole time basically is that what is shown is the sum of free space and the space used up by *this user*. 419+111 ~=540 (probably i remembered one of those two values incorrectly), and 419+330 ~=748gb. and i thought it was supposed to show the available total space (i.e. the total space that would be available if the hard disk was completely empty).

so i know now what the values represent. to an end-user these values might make sense, to me as the sole user and system admin i was puzzled... it would  seem more understandable to me if owncloud showed the remaining space instead of this constructed sum.

will finally close this issue now, though. thanks for fixing it somewhere in the past ;)
